intro: Scepocarpus obovatus, commonly known as the broad-leaf scepocarpus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Araliaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are typically glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by fruiting structures known as drupes. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in botanical gardens.
